title: Mizuno Wave Inspire 12 Provides Runners Built-In Support To Go Mile After Mile
text:

SOURCE Mizuno USA , Inc.
Dynamically Supportive and Flexibly Light, the New Mizuno Wave Inspire 12 Provides a Stable Foundation to Take Runners Even Further
NORCROSS, Ga. , Oct. 8, 2015 /PRNewswire/ -- Mizuno is placing support where runners need it most in the new release of the Mizuno Wave Inspire 12 launching in the U.S. this month. Providing a stable, supportive foundation to carry runners along their running journey no matter the mileage, the Wave Inspire 12 is a built-in support system for runners' feet with cushioning comfort and responsive support.
A favorite moderate support shoe amongst runners, the Wave Inspire 12 integrates Mizuno's newest midsole foam technology, U4icX (eu-phor-ic-X), to enhance the experience underfoot and eliminate stiffness that's common in support shoes. Additional support and stability is delivered in the sole platform through Mizuno Double Fan Wave® technology, which offers responsiveness from heel to midfoot; and new support groove pattern that evens out weight distribution at impact throughout the entire transition from heel to forefoot.
"The Wave Inspire 12 takes the moderate support shoe to another level, delivering the built-in support and cushion runners are seeking without adding weight and bulk to the shoe," said Mark Sheehan , Vice President of Product Management – Running, Mizuno USA . "The dynamic mix of Mizuno technologies will enable runners to push further than ever with confidence and comfort."
Adding to the enhancements in the new Wave Inspire 12, the upper was completely redesigned to provide a soft yet structural fit using 3D Fit technology. Hidden internal strapping provides an ideal fit around the midfoot combined with stretch laces to ensure a comfortable yet snug fit to keep runners focused on the road ahead. These upgrades have delivered a dynamically supportive and comfortable running shoe to elevate a runner's experience.
Recent wear-test remarks have runners raving about the new Wave Inspire 12 release.
"Loved the Wave Inspire 12. The cushioning is fantastic, lots of stability support but still light and comfy. It's a keeper." – Christina Ramirez, triathlonmami.com
"I suffer from chronic shin splints and general knee pain - these shoes helped in alleviating the pain on every run. The stability and cushion were the perfect combination for my running style." – C hristina Valenziano, theblissfulbalance.com
"The Mizuno Wave Inspire 12s are by far one of the lightest stability shoes I have ever put on. While they are light, the integrity of the shoe is not compromised - the support, cushion, and construction go beyond my expectations of a stability shoe. The Wave Inspire 12's give me the support that I need without adding the bulk and weight of other stability shoes." – Brandi Gilbert , funnerrunner.weebly.com
Runners can find the new Wave Inspire 12 running shoe in two-color options per gender at running specialty and sporting goods retailers nationwide, as well as online at www.mizuno.com . The suggested retail price is $119.99 .
Start following Mizuno Running on Facebook , Twitter and YouTube to share your running story and see first-hand the transformative power of running.
About Mizuno USA
Mizuno USA , Inc. is a wholly owned subsidiary of Mizuno Corporation, one of the largest specialty sporting goods manufacturers in the world. Mizuno USA , Inc. manufactures and distributes golf, baseball, softball, running, track & field, and volleyball equipment, apparel, and footwear for North America. Mizuno USA , Inc. is based in Norcross, Georgia .
